title: EDLD 651 Final Presentation
text: Elyse Calhoun, Frances Pinkham, Yitong Jiang, Eunji Kong

title: EDLD Final Project v2
text:
Code
schooling <- import(here("data","Schooling.csv"))




Code
schoolingsub <- schooling %>%
  select(rownames,ed76, daded, momed, wage76, iqscore, age76, nearc2, nearc4)




Code
schoolingsub1 <- schoolingsub |> 
  mutate(near_college = ifelse(nearc2 == "yes" & nearc4 =="yes", "near_colleges", 
                               ifelse(nearc2 == "yes" & nearc4 =="no","near_cc", 
                                      ifelse(nearc2 == "no" & nearc4 =="yes","near_4yr", "not_near_college")))) 




Code
schoolingsub1 <- schoolingsub1 %>%
  pivot_longer(
    cols = c(daded,momed),
    names_to = "parent",
    values_to = "par_education")

schoolingsub1$parent <- gsub("daded", "dad", schoolingsub1$parent)

schoolingsub1$parent <- gsub("momed", "mom", schoolingsub1$parent)


Demographics


Code
datasummary_skim(schoolingsub1 |> 
                   pivot_wider (names_from = parent,
                                values_from = par_education) |> 
                   select(-rownames),
                 histogram = FALSE)

Research question 1: What is the relationship between parent education and participant’s education?

Plot 1


Code
schoolingsub1 |> 
  ggplot(aes(par_education, ed76, color = parent)) +
  geom_smooth(method = lm, se = FALSE) + theme_minimal() +
  labs(title = "Relationship between Parent and Participant Education",
       subtitle = "From 1976 Survey",
       x = "Parental Education (yrs)",
       y = "Participant Education (yrs)",
       color = "Parent"
       )


`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'





Research question 2: What is the relationship between parent education and participant’s wage?


Plot 2


Code
schoolingsub1 |> 
  ggplot(aes(par_education, wage76, color = parent)) +
  geom_smooth(method = lm, se = FALSE) + theme_minimal() +
   labs(title = "Relationship between Parent Education and Participant Wages",
       subtitle = "From 1976 Survey",
       x = "Parental Education (yrs)",
       y = "Participant Wages (cents/hr)",
       color = "Parent"
       )


`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'





Research question 3: Is there a difference in wage depending on whether you lived near a college?


Table 1


Code
schoolingsub1$near_college <- gsub("near_4yr", "Near 4-year College", schoolingsub1$near_college)

schoolingsub1$near_college <- gsub("near_cc", "Near Community College", schoolingsub1$near_college)

schoolingsub1$near_college <- gsub("near_colleges", "Near 4-year  and Community College", schoolingsub1$near_college)

schoolingsub1$near_college <- gsub("not_near_college", "Not Near College", schoolingsub1$near_college)

schoolingsub1 %>%   
  group_by(near_college) |> 
  summarize(avg_wage = mean(wage76, na.rm = TRUE)/100) |>
  rename("Proximity to College" = near_college, "Participant Average Wage per Hour" = avg_wage) %>%
DT::datatable()

title: Reflection
text:
Elyse CalhounFrances PinkhamYitong JiangEunji Kong



Challenges faced

Understanding exactly what we were supposed to do for the Final Paper
Switching data sets during the Thanksgiving Break
Attempting to change variable names in a table
Trying to navigate R, github, and gitkraken in the correct order

Victories

Discovering that I messed up the qmd file trying to change variable names on a table, catching the mistake before pushing it back out to the group.
Teamwork makes the dream work.

Current Challenges

Gathering enough information to complete the final paper.





Challenges faced

Selecting a data set that was not excessively complicated but also not too clean
Gaining confidence in R syntax across multiple functions
Moving between Github, GitKraken, and RStudio

Victories

Managed to collaborate remotely!
Problem solved as a group
Able to diagnose problems more quickly

Current Challenges

Fluency in R language - I still have to review slides just about every time I work on an assignment to remember the proper syntax!





Challenges faced

Find a data set that we are familiar with the topic and are interested in exploring it.

Victories

Great communication in the team.
Everyone is willing to share the workloads.

Current Challenges

Create a figure for Research question 3: Is there a difference in wage depending on whether you lived near a college?





Challenges Faced

Working collaboratively on GitHub (confused with branches)

Victories

Working collaboratively on the analysis
Making website using Quarto (GitHub)

Current Challenges

Designing the website

Research question 3: Is there a difference in wage depending on whether you lived near a college?

Table 1


Code
schoolingsub1$near_college <- gsub("near_4yr", "Near 4-year College", schoolingsub1$near_college)

schoolingsub1$near_college <- gsub("near_cc", "Near Community College", schoolingsub1$near_college)

schoolingsub1$near_college <- gsub("near_colleges", "Near 4-year  and Community College", schoolingsub1$near_college)

  group_by(near_college) |>

title: The next R hurdle
text:
Add filter(), which is required for the final project.
Use fct_recode() to recode our variables, and work on other codes to make them more concise, if possible.
Explore potential relations among variables.
